name: Virtual Primate Exhibit
description:
DESCRIPTION

A small virtual museum exhibit that utilizes 3D models, generated from MRI scan data of real primate skulls, to explain the morphological features and differences between the Haplorhini and Strepsirrhini primate suborders. A narrator describes the skulls as users are free to walk around and inspect the skulls for themselves.

Please download the read me file for information on controls.

This experience was created as the final project for a college anthropology class.

Modeling & Programming
Gary Hansen

Writing & Narration
Samuel Wade

PLAYTHROUGH
